publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4348 Mr Brian Monteith: Football Sponsorship—That the Parliament recognises that commercial sponsorship of sporting events has a natural lifespan which means that it will evolve, change and end; notes that the Bank of Scotland’s sponsorship of the Scottish Premier League is to end after the 2006-07 season after nine successful years with an investment of £17 million; welcomes the Bank of Scotland’s continued support through major new investment of £1.5 million in grassroots football over the next three years; notes that 140,000 young people are expected to benefit, and wishes the Bank of Scotland and boys’ and girls’ football clubs every success in this new initiative.

S2M-4348 Mr Brian Monteith: Football Sponsorship—That the Parliament recognises that commercial sponsorship of sporting events has a natural lifespan which means that it will evolve, change and end; notes that the Bank of Scotland’s sponsorship of the Scottish Premier League is to end after the 2006-07 season after nine successful years with an investment of £17 million; welcomes the Bank of Scotland’s continued support through major new investment of £1.5 million in grassroots football over the next three years; notes that 140,000 young people are expected to benefit, and wishes the Bank of Scotland and boys’ and girls’ football clubs every success in this new initiative.
S2M-4348 Football Sponsorship (lodged on 4 May 2006) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-4348 Football Sponsorship (lodged on 4 May 2006) Alex Johnstone*, Mr Jim Wallace*, Michael Matheson*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Murdo Fraser*, Fergus Ewing*, Mike Pringle*, Brian Adam*, Bruce Crawford*
S2M-4348 Football Sponsorship (lodged on 4 May 2006) Dr Elaine Murray*
S2M-4348 Football Sponsorship (lodged on 4 May 2006) Mr David Davidson*
S2M-4348 Football Sponsorship (lodged on 4 May 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-4348 Football Sponsorship (lodged on 4 May 2006) Mr Kenneth Macintosh* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-4348 Football Sponsorship (lodged on 4 May 2006) Dennis Canavan*
